result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:26 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for Judge Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,Defendant Anthony Charles Holley not in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Anthony Charles Holley.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file and notes DE did not appear.  ADA Damrau states DE has been missing tests at JSC.  Court reviews absconder status letter filed by JSC. Court orders WARRANT- Body only.  Adjourned at 3:38 PM. bph
Notice of Absconder Status. Filed by JSC. ec: Attys. SEALED. kma
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED w/ access to parties.  gll  to kp 9/1

Attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Anthony Charles Holley.  Atty Dolfi states there is no resolution at this time, requesting a PTC. Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

02:37 PM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: Anthony Charles Holley appeared. S/T of Officer of Luke Radke of Hudson PD.  Direct by ADA Brekken. Cross by Atty. Dolfi.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Brekken does not think there will be additional charges on the Information.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide offer by 3/30/22.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 2:49 PM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Dolfi appointed. hml
Presigned.  gll
Preliminary hearing on February 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Defendant to have baseline test prior to being released from jail.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to have weekly contact with the Justice Support Center and sign appropriate release of information for Justice Support Center to obtain confirmation of mental health assessment. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Defendant to presign Waiver of Extradition prior to release.

01:23 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi and Kailtin Dippolito for today  DF:  Anthony Charles Holley appeared from jail. Defendant qualifies for PD.  DE updates address and confirms DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets Preliminary Hearing.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
